dataList.content: Urk… The smell… It’s awful…
Mmm… I can feel the waste collecting in my lungs.
The odor is so intense, it winds back to refreshing.
Let me warn you one last time: If you die here, Dante won’t be able to resuscitate you even when the battle has finished.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: Resuscitate…?

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: Must be a popular joke or something~ Whew, I can’t even tell what kind of stories circulate the City these days~
They seem to have misunderstood us, but seeing as Faust made no comment on it, I decided not to add my input.
The sources of this rancid smell were a more pressing concern.
<Looks like they probably died a while ago.>
An astute observation, Manager. The corpses have reached the stage of active decay.
Bleh, looks like the bugs are having a feast over there.
...Let’s just hurry along.
Huh… Something up, Gregor babe? Are you scared of bugs?
…Now, I’m sure you’re more mature than shoving dead bugs in someone’s face...
Boo!!!
But just in case one of y― Gah! Put it away! What’s so funny about this?!
Pffhaw… I mean, it’s hilarious… Who would’ve thought that you of all people’d be scared of these little wrigglers...
…Greg? Did you hate it that bad?
…Forget it.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: What an amazing clock you’ve got~ I haven’t seen that technology anywhere.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: T-That has to be on the level of a Singularity... What Wing could be responsible...
Hopkins greedily stared at my head.
I tried to ignore it, but looking at his stuffed pockets again...
Dante? Why are you clutching your head like that?
<I-It’s nothing.>
Miss Faust, can our manager not restore the lives of our guides using the clock’s power?
The clock will only work for us Sinners.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: Aw, gee~ I s’pose that’s for the better.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: Imagine you’re dragged right back to life with a gaping hole in your stomach. Wouldn’t that suck?

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: Nah, y'know what, you’re lucky if a hole is punched in your gut. You’d be a goner in seconds—
Ah.
A hard tentacle erupts from the wall and penetrates Aya’s abdomen in an instant.
All units, prepare for battle.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: …What’d I tell you?

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: I’ve always...been a lucky girl...

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: Aya!!
Her life has departed.
I know how you must be feeling, but you’ll have to keep it together for now, Yuri.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: B-But…
The attack is under an unusual form. It’s likely that we are facing an Abnormality.
Manager. Your command, please.
I felt pity for Yuri; she looked at Aya’s corpse and then back to us with tears. Nevertheless…
<…Yuri and Hopkins. Those two I can’t revive.>
<We have to fight now if we don’t want any more casualties.>
A wise decision, Manager.

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: You can make sense of that ticking…?
Outis gave Hopkins a fiery glare, but soon reminded herself of her priorities and breathed in to shout.
…It’s the manager’s order, lackeys!
You will surround the enemy in formation. The target is the Uniform ahead!

dataList.title: Grade 8 Fixer
dataList.content: …Yeah.
To be honest… I’m not sure if you can say that thing has a “form”.
Slowly encroaching vines, followed by the shadow of a figure that looks several times taller than a human.
It… was approaching, begetting fright unlike any foe we’ve faced up until now.
